name: brelrn
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: mp3an12(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, crn(c1)), wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe))
stmt.pretty: mp3an12(c0[c1]c2, c2 ∈ ran(c1), c0 ∈ 𝕌, c2 ∈ 𝕌)

body.origin:
|- wi(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, crn(c1)))
-| wcel(c0, universe)
-| wcel(c2, universe)
-| wi(w3a(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wbr(c0, c1, c2)), wcel(c2, crn(c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, crn(c1)))
-| wcel(c0, universe)
-| wcel(c2, universe)
-| wi(w3a(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wbr(c0, c1, c2)), wcel(c2, crn(c1)))

body.origin: |- wi(w3a(wcel(c0, universe), wcel(c2, universe), wbr(c0, c1, c2)), wcel(c2, crn(c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wbr(c0, c1, c2), wcel(c2, crn(c1)))
-| wcel(c0, universe)
-| wcel(c2, universe)

comment: The second argument of a binary relation belongs to its range. (Contributed by NM, 13-Aug-2004.)
